title: Robert Walser - Novels & Short Stories (5 books)
description:
ROBERT WALSER (1878-1956) was a German-speaking Swiss writer.  Among his early admirers were artists such as Robert Musil, Hermann Hesse, Stefan Zweig, Walter Benjamin and Franz Kafka.  Despite marginal early success in his literary career, the popularity of his work gradually diminished over the second and third decades of the 20th century.  He remained financially unstable and eventually suffered a nervous breakdown, spending the remainder of his life in sanatoriums and taking frequent long walks.

Walser's work was only rediscovered in the 1970s and are today regarded as being among the most important writings of literary modernism.  He has exerted a considerable influence on various contemporary German writers, including Ror Wolf, Peter Handke, W. G. Sebald, Max Goldt, and Enrique Vila-Matas.


The following books are in ePUB format:

* BERLIN STORIES (New York Review Books Classics, 2012).  Translated and with an Introduction by Susan Bernofsky.

* JAKOB VON GUNTEN (Vintage, 1983).  Translated and with an Introduction by Christopher Middleton.

* A SCHOOLBOY'S DIARY & OTHER STORIES (New York Review Books Classics, 2013).  Translated by Damion Searls.

* SELECTED STORIES (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1982).  Translated by Christopher Middleton and others, with a Foreword by Susan Sontag.

* THE TANNERS (New Directions, 2009).  Translated by Susan Bernofsky and with an Introduction by W. G. Sebald.
